title: 112_hr5994
content:
The "Choice in Healthcare Act" may be cited as the official title. This act focuses on Medicare and Medicaid choice. The "Choice in Healthcare Act" establishes a demonstration program for Medicare and Medicaid eligible beneficiaries to purchase qualifying health benefits coverage and access a Medi-Choice card for healthcare expenditures. The "Choice in Healthcare Act" sets requirements for qualifying health benefits coverage for dual eligible beneficiaries, Medicare eligible beneficiaries, and Medicaid eligible beneficiaries. The coverage under the demonstration program for Medicaid eligible beneficiaries in California must be as comprehensive as the State Medicaid plan, offered on a guaranteed issue basis without preexisting condition exclusions, and with uniform premiums that do not vary based on individual characteristics. SEC. 3. MEDI-CHOICE CARD. The Secretary will contract with a credit card provider to issue Medi-Choice cards for purchasing health benefits coverage and covering out-of-pocket costs for eligible beneficiaries in the demonstration program. Unused amounts on a Medi-Choice card will remain available until expended by an enrolled eligible beneficiary during the program. SEC. 4. ELIGIBLE BENEFICIARIES. In this Act, an eligible beneficiary is defined as a legal permanent resident of the United States within the covered area, eligible for medical assistance under the State plan or entitled to benefits under part A of title XVIII of the Social Security Act. Exclusions apply to individuals enrolled in certain programs or entitled to specific benefits. The Act defines eligible beneficiaries as legal permanent residents of the United States eligible for medical assistance or entitled to benefits under the Social Security Act. Exclusions apply to individuals enrolled in specific programs or entitled to certain benefits. Medicare eligible beneficiaries are described in subsection (a)(2)(B), Medicaid eligible beneficiaries in subsection (a)(2)(A), and dual eligible beneficiaries are both Medicare and Medicaid eligible. SEC. 5. FUNDING OF MEDI-CHOICE CARDS. The Secretary will provide funds through the Medi-Choice card for dual eligible beneficiaries based on the average values of medical assistance and benefits under certain titles of the Social Security Act, with annual adjustments for inflation. For non-dual eligible Medicaid beneficiaries, the annual deposit amount is based on the average nominal dollar value of medical assistance under title XIX of the Social Security Act, with annual inflation adjustments. For non-dual eligible Medicare beneficiaries, the annual deposit amount is determined similarly. The annual deposit amount for non-dual eligible Medicaid beneficiaries is based on the average nominal dollar value of medical assistance under title XIX of the Social Security Act, with annual inflation adjustments. The payment amounts for individuals are adjusted based on relative risk. Any computed amount not a multiple of $12 is rounded to the nearest multiple of $12. The annual deposit amount for non-dual eligible Medicaid beneficiaries is adjusted based on relative risk factors and income levels. Higher-income individuals may have their annual amount reduced based on their modified adjusted gross income. Additionally, there is an annual inflation adjustment based on the average of certain factors. The annual deposit amount for non-dual eligible Medicaid beneficiaries is adjusted based on relative risk factors and income levels. Deposits to Medi-Choice cards are credited monthly and prorated for partial months of program enrollment. SEC. 6. SCOPE OF DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM.

The demonstration program will be conducted in Kern, Tulare, Kings, Fresno, Merced, Madera, Stanislaus, and San Joaquin counties in California for a 10-year period starting on June 1, 2013. Enrollment is limited to 100,000 eligible beneficiaries at any time.

SEC. 7. PAYMENT OF COSTS. The Secretary is responsible for operating the demonstration program and covering costs, including amounts deposited onto Medi-Choice cards. Costs attributable to Medicare or Medicaid eligible beneficiaries will be paid from the respective trust funds or appropriated amounts. No duplicate payments allowed, except as provided in section 8(d)(2). No duplicate payments allowed for eligible beneficiaries in the demonstration program under title XVIII or XIX of the Social Security Act. No duplicate payments allowed for eligible beneficiaries in the demonstration program under title XVIII or XIX of the Social Security Act. SEC. 8. MISCELLANEOUS. The Secretary provides assistance in enrollment for eligible beneficiaries in the demonstration program, including a toll-free phone number and information on plan options. Amounts paid into a Medi-Choice card are not considered income for tax or eligibility purposes. Participants are not responsible for premium payments under Medicare or Medicaid, but must use benefits for purchasing health coverage. The demonstration program assists eligible beneficiaries in enrolling for health coverage. Participants are not entitled to Medicaid benefits for services covered under the program. Medical assistance under Medicaid continues for services not covered by the program.
